DataElement.preferredName: Donor Cellular Infusion Disease or Disorder Status Prior Next  Received Complete Remission Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A form of adoptive immunotherapy used after hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT). Lymphocytes from the original stem cell donor are given to the HSCT recipient, after the transplant, to augment an antitumor immune response (graft-versus-tumor), or ensure that the donor stem cells remain engrafted. Although lymphocytes are the most commonly used cell, other cells including fibroblasts, mesenchymal or dendritic cells may be delivered to affect chimerism, treat Graft vs. Host Disease, treat viral infections or Post Transplant Lymphoproliferative Disease or other novel uses under investigation._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. Sometimes the term is used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A condition or state at a particular time._Earlier in time or order._Subsequent; immediately following in time or order._To have taken, accepted, or gotten something offered._The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.  This does not always mean the cancer has been cured._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Although lymphocytes are the most commonly used cell, other cells including fibroblasts, mesenchymal or dendritic cells may be delivered to affect chimerism, treat Graft vs. Host Disease, treat viral infections or Post Transplant Lymphoproliferative Disease or other novel uses under investigation._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. Sometimes the term is used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A condition or state at a particular time._Earlier in time or order._Subsequent; immediately following in time or order._To have taken, accepted, or gotten something offered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A form of adoptive immunotherapy used after hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT). Lymphocytes from the original stem cell donor are given to the HSCT recipient, after the transplant, to augment an antitumor immune response (graft-versus-tumor), or ensure that the donor stem cells remain engrafted. Although lymphocytes are the most commonly used cell, other cells including fibroblasts, mesenchymal or dendritic cells may be delivered to affect chimerism, treat Graft vs. Host Disease, treat viral infections or Post Transplant Lymphoproliferative Disease or other novel uses under investigation.

Concepts.definition: A form of adoptive immunotherapy used after hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT). Lymphocytes from the original stem cell donor are given to the HSCT recipient, after the transplant, to augment an antitumor immune response (graft-versus-tumor), or ensure that the donor stem cells remain engrafted. Although lymphocytes are the most commonly used cell, other cells including fibroblasts, mesenchymal or dendritic cells may be delivered to affect chimerism, treat Graft vs. Host Disease, treat viral infections or Post Transplant Lymphoproliferative Disease or other novel uses under investigation.

Property.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.:A condition or state at a particular time.:Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.:Earlier in time or order.:Received; taken, gotten, or acquired.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
A condition or state at a particular time.
Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.
Earlier in time or order.
To take, accept, or get something offered.

The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

The outward or visible aspect of a person or thing.
Relating to or produced by or consisting of molecules.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::100: A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.: The occurrence in an individual of two or more cell populations of different chromosomal constitutions, derived from different individuals. This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).
Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

The occurrence in an individual of two or more cell populations of different chromosomal constitutions, derived from different individuals. This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual.

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping for CDE:2681019
ReferenceDocuments.description: [IF EXISTS THEN "Not Assessed"] PerformedObservation.negationIndicator WHERE PerformedObseration > DefinedObservation.nameCode ="assess disease status" AND DefinedObservation [assessment] > DefonedCompositionRelationship > DefinedProcedure.nameCode = "Perform Post-HCT Recovery Activities" AND DefinedProcedure [post-HCT] > DefonedCompositionRelationship > DefinedProcedure.nameCode = "collect follow-up data"   [ELSE IF EXISTS THEN "CR"] PerformedDiagnosis.diseaseStatusCode = "CR" WHERE PerformedDiagnosis > PerformedSubstanceAdministration > DefinedSubstanceAdministration.nameCode = "Administer Donor Cellular Infusion(DCI)" AND  DefinedObservation [assessment] > DefonedCompositionRelationship > DefinedProcedure.nameCode = "Perform Post-HCT Recovery Activities" AND DefinedProcedure [post-HCT] > DefonedCompositionRelationship > DefinedProcedure.nameCode = "collect follow-up data"   [ELSE THEN "Not in CR"]
